skillTree.localised_description: The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

skillTree.localised_description: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

skillTree.localised_description: The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Who needs a cumbersome blade when the perfect weapon is literally at your fingertips?
Maybe it is the near-constant state of regeneration that gives the hide a toughened sheen, almost impervious to claw, talon or blade.
The clang of his hammer marks both construction and destruction — and always conquest.

effects.description:
Marauders to Builders commandment: additional +10 Growth
	(all provinces)

Missile strength: +20% for Longship units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “Trade is war by other means.”

effects.description:
Upkeep: -15% for Longship units
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: "With this, a mere gesture can bring fleets to heel — or raise the storm."
With hammer in hand, Hafskael builds ports, smashes skulls, and commands the sea.

effects.description:
Global recruitment duration: -2 turn for Longship units
	(factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: A master shipwright and war-priest, he brings divine fury and naval might in equal measure.

effects.description:
Character experience gain: +25%
	(Heroes in local province)

Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: "When this banner flies, ships do not sink — and men do not flee."
Harbinger of storms and stone, Hafskael carves empires from both seawater and granite.

effects.description:
Unit mass: +15% for Longship units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Many are the dark horrors of twisted flesh and nightmares made real that the Ruinous Powers have visited upon the world, but few are quite as vicious.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Don't go anywhere near its mouth - in fact, don't even get within snapping distance if you value your limbs.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
It is never enough. The food, the drink, the slaughter. It is never, ever enough.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Blink and you die.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

items.colour_text: Simple in make, brutal in purpose. Dockiron bears no ornate sigils or runes — only the scars of years spent raising piers and collapsing skulls. Once a tool for driving mooring stakes into hard stone, its dense weight and unforgiving face now serve Hafskael on the battlefield. Blood cakes the haft where pitch once clung, and every impact rings with the sound of breaking boards... or bones.

This humble, sea-worn figurehead of a galloping steed was once mounted beneath the prow of the Sternwolf, a legendary longship. Now worn as a talisman by Hafskael, it carries the blessing of the sea gods and the ancestral strength of the Bjornling fleet. It still smells faintly of salt, pitch, and a battle long past.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Hrimross's Charm" for Longship units
	(all armies factionwide)

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: “Every tide bends to those who build the shore.”
